page.title: 13Bednall Village.
page.content: On the outskirts of Bednall Village is Bednall Villa. This large villa has a small caravan site built into the garden. There are 3 caravans there with built-in hot and cold water as well as flushing toilets. Next to this is a disused well and stream surrounded by hilly farmland, sometimes wooded. This is used for cattle grazing. There are two farms, Southall's which is arable and Lower Farm which has battery hens and cattle. Bednall church dates back to the 13th century. The church clock is rewound every Sunday. A group of 8 council houses built in 1940's stands in front of the church. They have trouble with flies from the chicken farm next door. Most other houses in the village are modern except the mansion. The village shop includes a post office and general store.
